page.title: 16LOCAL HISTORY 3
page.content: Mount Wellington was operational{ corn {mill} well into this century. Mill- leat, 3 cottages & farm buildings remain, but grain not now grown locally. Another cornmill existed on site of Greeta House and 2 cottages. In 1849 a factory, mill house and 4 cottages were here. Thomas & Henry Smithies began the {cotton mill}c.1760 and it was sold on Richard Smithies' death in 1840. The new owner, Levi Towler, came from Colne. In 1896 Ford Ayrton's, silk-spinners, Low Bentham, rented the premises but the mill was closed in 1904. Thomas Coates used the mill - race to power his pottery machinery for a time. Present sewage field was the site of his clay-pans and his engine bed can be found on Greta Heath. Traces of a weir also exist.
